Description: Terracotta figure fragment of grapes. Mould-made. White coating preserved on some areas. Red-brown fabric with grey core. Abundant fine gold mica, quartz and white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Resembles Ptolemaic terracottas workshop fabric from Naukratis. A bunch of grapes, possibly as a fragment of flask have parallels from Egypt (Bailey 2008: nos. 3337, 3783 and particularly 3784) dated 1st century BC to 1st century AD date, though similar vessels have also been dated upto the 3rd century AD (Dunand 1990: no. 1102, Roman; Bayer-Niemeier 1988: no.757, 3rd century AD). Cambridge MCA fragments NA327, NA467 and NA630 may be from the same vessel. Bayer Niemeier, E. 1988. ‘Liebieghaus Museum Alter Plastik. Bildwerke der Sammlung Kaufmann, 1. Griechisch-römische Terrakotten’. Melsungen. Dunand, F. 1990. ‘Musée du Louvre. Département des antiquités égyptiennes. Catalogue des terres cuites grécoromaines d'Egypte’. Paris.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.607) (Phase 1)
